BAD NEYM Barcelona star Neymar is not a role model for kids…and anyone wearing his shirt ‘supports corruption 
Brazilian tycoon claims he is a victim of fraud orchestrated by Neymar, his parents and Barca through fake contracts By Geoff Sweet 31st March 2017, 12:18 pm Updated: 31st March 2017, 12:33 pm Comments A leading Brazilian tycoon claims that Barcelona ace Neymar is not a suitable role model for kids. 
And Delcir Sonda, founder of the DIS stable that owns rights in some of the world’s leading players, also insists that anyone wearing Neymar’s shirt was “supporting corruption”. Getty Images 5 Neymar flanked by Barcelona president Sandro Rosell and sports director Andoni Zubizarreta when he signed in 2013 
Sonda is currently involved in legal proceedings against the Brazil star who became part of DIS as a budding 17-year-old. 
Keep up to date with ALL the FOOTBALL news, gossip, transfers and goals plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
The company owned 40 per cent of Neymar’s rights, bought for around £1.25million, but they now say that the player and his family were behind a scheme that saw Santos reclaim a greater percentage of the transfer fee that Barcelona paid for him. 
Rages Sonda: “I was betrayed by Neymar, by his father and his mother. There was a fraud orchestrated by Neymar, his parents and Barcelona through fake contracts. Getty Images Neymar celebrates a goalden Barca moment…but elsewhere he is accused of not being a decent role model for kids Rex Features 5 The Barcelona striker is also accused of supporting corruption 
“Neymar has lied and continues to lie, right up to today. Neymar isn’t an example for our children. We’re in the middle of immense corruption and we need to set an example for our children. Neymar, Barcelona and Santos will stand trial on fraud and corruption charges over the transfer of the Brazilian forward after their appeals were turned down by Spain’s High Court. 
Neymar’s mother Nadine Goncalves and the family company N&N also had appeals rejected. EFE Neymar Sr, father of the Barca star, leaves the National Court after giving evidence on his son’s transfer EFE 5 Barcelona president Rosell, his predecessor Josep Maria Bartomeu and Barca general director Nacho Mestre arrive to give their evidence 
Barca previously have admitted to a Spanish judge that in 2011 they handed Neymar an £8.5m pre-contract to move to the Nou Camp while he was still at Santos. 
A further £25.5m was paid in 2013 when Neymar finally made the move to Spain. 
Under Fifa regulations players are only allowed to negotiate deals with other clubs when they in their last six months of a contract.
